column5: Well after alot of searching... and I mean alot! I finally found exactly what I was looking for...  I would like to introduce you to Hunter.    He is the yellow with the black nose..    I pick him up on Oct 2nd... man is it going to be a long couple weeks!  He will certainly be a welcome companion.  (Hope no one sees this as spam..) Incase anyone is wondering I purchased him from Silver D Kennels.. More dedicated breeders you will not find. They are CKC registered and Hunters' Sire is a national field champion. http://www.silverdkennels.com/index.html  G.
spam? looks like dogs to me! great dogs!
He looks perfect Gerrett! I would pick one of each color myself hehe. And thanks for the link.
Congrats on the new hunting/fishing buddy.  I took mine hunting last ngiht for the first time and laughed the hole time.  Awsome feeling!
cute, cute, cute, cute, cute,...........  A pal who will always listen to your every word when the rest of your family is ignoring you   Enjoy!
A real cuty gerritt    Congrats  Leechman
Nice looking pup G, hope you guys have many great years with Hunter.
Looks like a beauty!  Great choice on the black nose and big blocky head!
Awwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww
That is one beauty you picked Gerritt. I'm a Golden Retriever guy myself but the Labrador Retriever is an extremely close second!!  Treat Hunter well and you'll get it back in spades.
Congrats Gerritt, very cute.  I sent you a PM by the way...
Awesome G!!! He looks like a fine puppy!
Nice choice Gerritt! I would have went with the Chocolate myself.  I miss my dog so much, wish I had my own place and I would get another in a heartbeat. Is this your first lab?

Too cute....but you can have that 'Puppy Stage'!  And just a bit of a caution...when we got our Puppy (years ago), I ended up with a very nasty, nasty infection in my sinus.  It took over a year to detect as the pain was being felt in a tooth.  So...after the regular dentist then a specialist and then a final specialist (grumpy old man) who told me to lay off the advil (was taking 2 every 4 hours for a year) and to see my doc.  They were quite surprised with the x-ray and put me on heavy duty antibiotics for 21 days.  I finally was able to put the advil away after 14 days on the meds.  Give him a good bath when you get him home.
Congrats What a cute pup.
ahhhhhh.. too cute.
Man!.........way to rain on a cute puppy parade lol (jk)
Fine pup you got there !!! Congrads....

Actually the advice is excellent. You want to get the puppy used to baths, paw handling, nail clipping, teeth brushing, ear cleaning, etc.  Nothing worse than a large ill mannered dog when trying to do the basic things that will ensure a long and healthy life.  Edited to add ear cleaning - how could I forget having a GR.
Make sure he doesn't out fish you.

thanks for all the comments and advice guys and girls..  This is not my first lab, I grew up caring for them... and I chose him because he had a "Box like head" much like his father who in my eyes was stout and strong... Hunter was the largest in the litter too I should add..  I picked up a crate today from Albert (Hometownhandyman) what a great guy he is! I just wish I had alot more time to chat with him... Soon enough eh Albert?  Thanks to everyone for their comments.  G
Nice looking pup ya got there Gerritt, wish you many years together We just got ours last week,and he already makes a difference to our lives
Thanks for the kind words. You failed to realize that we now have a obligation to go fishing together soon. (grin) I enjoyed meeting you as well. Use the crate in good health!
